intro: Cynoglossum ovatum, commonly known as the broadleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, hairy leaves and clusters of blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. It is often found in woodland areas, meadows, and along stream banks. Cynoglossum ovatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
